title: Grid Paths
core_prompt: How many shortest paths are there from A to B on a 3×3 grid if you can only move right or up?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: Now block one middle intersection. How many shortest paths remain?
extensions.note: Choose a blocked node and compute via dynamic programming.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: What pattern do you notice for an N×N grid? Describe it.
extensions.note: Look for combinations: choose N rights among 2N moves.

hint_ladder: Start smaller: try a 1×1 and 2×2 grid first.
Make a table: ways to reach each point = left + below.
This becomes a number pattern (like Pascal’s triangle).
Reveal: Use dynamic programming or combinations.
solution_steps: Use dynamic programming: ways at each point = ways from left + ways from below.
Fill the grid; the top-right becomes 20.
